claim.text: Multimodal Deep Regression Model (MDRM) outperforms all baselines in predicting stock volatility.
claim.exact_quote: The results show that our multimodal deep regression model (MDRM) outperforms all baselines.

evidence.evidence_text: MDRM (text+audio) significantly outperforms MDRM (text only) and MDRM (audio only) for 3-days, 7-days and 15 days stock volatility prediction.
evidence.limitations: The improvement is not statistically significant for 30 days prediction.
evidence.location: Table 1: MSE of different models on stock volatility prediction τ -days following the conference call.
evidence.exact_quote: Multimodal Deep Regression Model (MDRM) (text+audio) outperforms MDRM (text only) and MDRM (audio only) for 3-days, 7-days and 15 days stock volatility prediction.

evidence.evidence_text: MDRM (text+audio) outperforms simple fusion model by 19.1% for 3-days prediction.
evidence.limitations: The improvement is not statistically significant for 30 days prediction.
evidence.location: Table 1: MSE of different models on stock volatility prediction τ -days following the conference call.
evidence.exact_quote: MDRM (text+audio) outperforms simple fusion model by 19.1% for 3-days prediction.

evidence.evidence_text: MDRM (text+audio) outperforms bc-LSTM (Poria et al., 2017) by 3.3% for 3-days prediction.
evidence.limitations: The improvement is not statistically significant for 30 days prediction.
evidence.location: Table 1: MSE of different models on stock volatility prediction τ -days following the conference call.
evidence.exact_quote: MDRM (text+audio) outperforms bc-LSTM (Poria et al., 2017) by 3.3% for 3-days prediction.

evaluation.justification: The evidence shows that MDRM (text+audio) consistently outperforms other models in short-term volatility prediction.
evaluation.key_limitations: The improvement is not statistically significant for long-term volatility prediction.

claim.text: Both text and audio modalities are helpful in predicting stock volatility.

evidence.evidence_text: MDRM (text+audio) outperforms MDRM (text only) by 4.2% for 3-days prediction.
evidence.limitations: The improvement is not statistically significant for 30 days prediction.
evidence.location: Table 1: MSE of different models on stock volatility prediction τ -days following the conference call.
evidence.exact_quote: Multimodal (1.371) outperform MDRM (text only) by 4.2% for 3-days prediction.

evidence.evidence_text: MDRM (text+audio) outperforms MDRM (audio only) by 4.2% for 3-days prediction.
evidence.limitations: The improvement is not statistically significant for 30 days prediction.
evidence.location: Table 1: MSE of different models on stock volatility prediction τ -days following the conference call.
evidence.exact_quote: MDRM (text+audio) outperforms MDRM (audio only) by 4.2% for 3-days prediction.

evaluation.justification: The evidence shows that both text and audio modalities contribute to the performance of MDRM.
evaluation.key_limitations: The improvement is not statistically significant for long-term volatility prediction.

claim.text: Some individual vocal features are important in predicting stock volatility.
claim.exact_quote: Without mean pitch feature, the MSE of our model increases 0.7%.

evidence.evidence_text: Without mean pitch feature, the MSE of our model increases 0.7%.
evidence.limitations: The impact of other vocal features is not discussed.
evidence.exact_quote: Without mean pitch feature, the MSE of our model increases 0.7%.

evidence.evidence_text: Without standard deviation of pitch feature, the MSE of our model increases 0.65%.
evidence.limitations: The impact of other vocal features is not discussed.
evidence.exact_quote: Without standard deviation of pitch feature, the MSE of our model increases 0.65%.

evidence.evidence_text: Without mean intensity feature, the MSE of our model increases 0.63%.
evidence.limitations: The impact of other vocal features is not discussed.
evidence.exact_quote: Without mean intensity feature, the MSE of our model increases 0.63%.

evidence.evidence_text: Without number of pulses feature, the MSE of our model increases 0.56%.
evidence.limitations: The impact of other vocal features is not discussed.
evidence.exact_quote: Without number of pulses feature, the MSE of our model increases 0.56%.

evaluation.justification: The evidence shows that some individual vocal features contribute to the performance of MDRM.
evaluation.key_limitations: The impact of other vocal features is not discussed.

claim.text: Short-term volatility prediction is harder than long-term volatility prediction.
claim.exact_quote: The 3days prediction MSE of MDRM is 1.371, while the 30-days MSE is 0.217.

evidence.evidence_text: The 3days prediction MSE of MDRM is 1.371, while the 30-days MSE is 0.217.
evidence.limitations: The improvement is not statistically significant for 30 days prediction.
evidence.exact_quote: The 3days prediction MSE of MDRM is 1.371, while the 30-days MSE is 0.217.

evaluation.justification: The evidence shows that short-term volatility prediction error is much greater than long-term prediction error.
evaluation.key_limitations: The improvement is not statistically significant for 30 days prediction.

claim.text: Marginal gain over simple models is diminishing in long-term volatility prediction.
claim.exact_quote: The gain of MDRM over past volatility baseline v[past] diminishes from 54% (τ = 3) to 6% (τ = 30).

evidence.evidence_text: The gain of MDRM over past volatility baseline v[past] diminishes from 54% (τ = 3) to 6% (τ = 30).
evidence.limitations: The improvement is not statistically significant for 30 days prediction.
evidence.exact_quote: The gain of MDRM over past volatility baseline v[past] diminishes from 54% (τ = 3) to 6% (τ = 30).

evaluation.justification: The evidence shows that the improvement of MDRM over simple models diminishes as the prediction horizon increases.
evaluation.key_limitations: The improvement is not statistically significant for 30 days prediction.

claim.text: Case study: AMD Conference Call First Quarter 2017
claim.exact_quote: Case study: AMD Conference Call First Quarter 2017

evidence.evidence_text: The stock price dropped by 16.1% after the company’s earnings conference call.
evidence.limitations: The case study is based on a single event, and the findings may not be generalizable.
evidence.exact_quote: May 1st 2017 is a bad day for AMD investors. After the company’s earnings conference call, the stock price dropped by 16.1% in the post market session.

evaluation.justification: The case study provides an example of how multimodal features can be used to predict stock volatility.
evaluation.key_limitations: The findings are based on a single event, and the findings may not be generalizable.
